 to 
  catch(boost::filesystem::filesystem_error &_e)

content.raw:
In the original post, I'm guessing the problem is that you don't have protobuf installed. Are you using Ubuntu? There's a list of the ubuntu packages to install for a source build on the [Install wiki page](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/1.6/install#Instructions).

For the comment regarding 1.7.0, this may be a boost incompatibility. I'll look into it.
content.html:
In the original post, I'm guessing the problem is that you don't have protobuf installed. Are you using Ubuntu? There's a list of the ubuntu packages to install for a source build on the Install wiki page.

For the comment regarding 1.7.0, this may be a boost incompatibility. I'll look into it.

content.raw: It's complaining about pure virtual functions, which should be implemented in the auto-generated *.pb.cc and *.pb.h files. Here's some auto-generated protobuf files for reference. If your files look like these, we should debug the linking.
content.html: It's complaining about pure virtual functions, which should be implemented in the auto-generated .pb.cc and .pb.h files. Here's some auto-generated protobuf files for reference. If your files look like these, we should debug the linking.

content.raw: The files are the same. What I have to do?
content.html: The files are the same. What I have to do?

content.raw:
I confirm the existence of this issue. I am running the same configuration on my machine. 

Attilio
content.html:

content.raw:
Same problem here:
ArchLinux 64 bits
gazebo 1.7.1
protobuf 2.5.0
content.html: Same problem here: ArchLinux 64 bits gazebo 1.7.1 protobuf 2.5.0

Don't have the patience to wait until July. Had the same issue as my fellow Archers (also x86_64) but the declaration in question doesn't appear to ever be used so I just commented it out, which worked fine.

Patch:

--- gazebo/physics/World.hh.orig
+++ gazebo/physics/World.hh
@@ -462,7 +462,7 @@
       private: EntityPtr selectedEntity;

       /// \brief Incoming message buffer.
-      private: std::vector<google::protobuf::Message> messages;
+      //private: std::vector<google::protobuf::Message> messages;

       /// \brief Name of the world.
       private: std::string name;

Of course after that there was another problem, this time with Qt and boost. But that can be fixed with the following command (executed at the source-tree root):

$ find -type f -print0|xargs -0 -L 1 sed -i 's/^#include.*<boost.*>[[:space:]]*$/#ifndef Q_MOC_RUN\n\0\n#endif/'

At this point the source compiles, which is a good start. However, on startup it begins to launch and then crashes at the appearance of the GUI with (repeated nearly a dozen times):

libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile

I don't have a fix this one yet and I'm debating whether or not it's even worth it to try since this program is just rather buggy for my liking. But somebody else can take a crack at it if they want. Or the developers if they know the particular issue here.

Note: All of this is based on gazebo v1.8.0

content.raw: pull request #561 removes the messages vector in `World.hh`
content.html: pull request #561 removes the messages vector in World.hh

content.raw: I've put the protobuf and qt/boost fixes in pull request #615 targeted for gazebo_1.8. I haven't had a chance to investigate the libpng errors.
content.html: I've put the protobuf and qt/boost fixes in pull request #615 targeted for gazebo_1.8. I haven't had a chance to investigate the libpng errors.
